item.title: New book: Statistics in Natural Resources: Applications with R
item.description: At the start of the pandemic in 2020, I was worried. Not just for the serious global health impacts, but also for the workload I would soon be faced with. I taught an introductory statistics course for graduate students in the natural resources and agricultural disciplines, and was scrambling to find out how I would migrate my course material to an online, asynchronous format. At the same time, I was searching for a different textbook to use for the course.
